chapter.title: Compatibility Level Versions
chapter.para: Each host managed by Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager has a version of VDSM installed. A more recent version of the Manager can manage hosts with a version of VDSM from an older version of Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization installed. However, since a VM may be migrated from host to host within a cluster, the Manager will not use features from a given version of VDSM until all hosts within a cluster have that VDSM version (or more recent) installed.

This concept is represented in the API by each host being said to be at a compatibility level, corresponding to the version of VDSM installed. A version element containing major and minor attributes describes a compatibility level.

Once all hosts within a cluster have been upgraded to a certain level, that level's version will appear under a supported_versions element. This indicates that the cluster's version may now be updated to that level. Likewise, once all clusters within a data center have been updated to a given level, the data center may then be updated to that level.
For example, if you have a Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager 2.2 instance and you update to 2.3, the API will report:
chapter.screen:
<host ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> ... </host>
<cluster ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions/> ... </cluster>
<data_center ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions/> ... </data_center>
chapter.para: Once all hosts within a cluster have been updated to VDSM from 2.3, the API will report:
chapter.screen:
<host ...> ... <version major="2" minor="3"/> ... </host>
<cluster ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions> <version major="2" minor="3"/> </supported_versions> ... </cluster>
<data_center ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions/> ... </data_center>
chapter.para: The cluster may then updated to 2.3 and the API will report:
chapter.screen:
<cluster ...> ... <version major="2" minor="3"/> <supported_versions/> ... </cluster>
<data_center ...> ... <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions> <version major="2" minor="3"/> </supported_versions> ... </data_center>
chapter.para: This indicates that the data center may be updated to 2.3
